data.title: Accessible Information Standard Questionnaire
data.meta_description: It’s a legal requirement, according to the Equality Act 2010, to make all of our information accessible. We must also follow the Accessible Regulations 2018 for…
data.text:
First Name *

Last Name *

Email *

Date of birth *

Please use format day/month/year e.g. 12/05/1979

Phone Number *

What is your preferred method of communication? *

British Sign Language

Makaton

Speech

Written

Do you require any of the following?

Audible alert

Communication partner

Communication support worker

Deafblind block alphabet interpreter

Deafblind communicator guide

Deafblind haptic communication interpreter

Deafblind manual alphabet interpreter

Recording on personal audio recording device

Lipspeaker

Loud verbal communication

Manual note taker

Sighted guide

Slow verbal communication

Speech to text reporter

Tactile alert

Third party to read out written information

Visual alert

Interpreter

Advocate

Home visit request by district nurse

Communication support finding

Communication aid

How would you prefer us to give you information?

By email

In contracted (Grade 2) Braille

In Easyread

In electronic audio format

In electronic downloadable format

In Makaton

In Moon alphabet

In uncontracted (Grade 1) Braille

On audio cassette tapeOn compact disc

On digital versatile disc

On USB (universal serial bus) mass storage device

Verbally

How would you prefer us to contact you?

Email

Letter

Short text message service

TelephoneText relay

Via a carer

Do you prefer your written information in any of the following formats?

In at least 20 point sans serif font

In at least 24 point sans serif font

In at least 28 point sans serif font

In large font

Do you currently use any of the following?

A citizen advocate

A legal advocate

Alternative and augmentative communication

Alternative communication skill

Apps on mobile device to support communication

British Sign Language interpreter

Communication device

Cued speech transliterator

Deafblind intervener

Deafblind Manual Alphabet

Electronic note taker

Hearing loop

High technology communication device

Lipspeaker

Low technology communication device

Manual note taker

Personal audio recording device to record information

Personal Communication Passport

Photographs for communication

Sign language

Speech to text reporter

Switches for communication

Symbols for communication

Tadoma method for communication

TextphoneVoice amplifier to support communication

Voice output communication aid

British sign language

Lip-reading

Makaton sign language

A hearing aid
